brief_summary.textblock:
The recent developments of research on iPS (induced pluripotent stem) cells lead to the
      establishment of mature cell lines such as cardiomyocytes or valvular interstitial cells
      with genetic and cellular characteristics of the donors. These cells represent a biological
      material more readily available to identify the pathophysiological mechanisms involved in
      the diseases of BrS or ERS patients, which will lead to the identification of genetic
      markers.

clinical_study.brief_title: Molecular Mechanism Identification in Inherited Arrhythmias and Valvulopathies From Induced Pluripotent Stem Cells

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:

          -  Patient with a family history of inherited arrhythmia or valvulopathy

          -  Age : 22-60 yo.

          -  patient no confine to bed

          -  Male or female

          -  Written consent

          -  Patient affiliated to the French social security

        Exclusion criteria:

          -  Pregnant woman

          -  Patient under 22 yo or adults under guardianship

          -  Indication against local anesthesia

          -  Anticoagulant treatment

          -  Absence or positivity of HIV, HBV, HCV serology

clinical_study.official_title: Molecular Mechanism Identification in Inherited Arrhythmias and Valvulopathies From Induced Pluripotent Stem Cells

oversight_info.authority: France : Agence Française de Sécurité Sanitaire des Produits de Santé

primary_outcome.measure: Production of cardiomyocytes modele from skin fibroblast of arrhythmic patient

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Production of valve interstitial cells modele from skin fibroblast of patient with a valvulopathy
